rename.from: FTP Backend - Failed to create file system for "target:/TEST": unsupported LIST line
rename.to: FTP - Failed to create file system for "target:/TEST": unsupported LIST line

body:
> unsupported LIST line

That error means the ftp library had trouble parsing the listing line.

I put this one into the parser

> 2023/03/22 19:32:26 DEBUG : FTP Rx: "Size=2258880811416;Modify=20230322173224.000;Create=20221213132421.000;Type=dir; TEST"

And it worked fine.

I suspect that this blank line is causing the problem

> 2023/03/22 19:32:26 DEBUG : FTP Rx: ""

I think this is probably invalid output from the server.

Which server is it? It should say in the `-vv` log above but I think you've sanitized it.

It would be worth trying [the latest beta](https://beta.rclone.org/) to see if the recent ftp library update fixed it.

If not then this needs a fix to the upstream library.

Also - do you need to use leading `/`? Try your commands without a leading `/` and if they work use that.

@ncw, thanks for getting back to me.

> Which server is it? It should say in the -vv log above but I think you've sanitized it.

I have not removed any lines from the log and sanitized only the username + host. Unfortunately, the FTP does not advertise what it is exactly. It belongs to a private hosting company.

> It would be worth trying [the latest beta](https://beta.rclone.org/) to see if the recent ftp library update fixed it.

Same error. I have used the following version:

```
rclone v1.63.0-beta.6865.866600a73
- os/version: darwin 12.6 (64 bit)
- os/kernel: 21.6.0 (arm64)
- os/type: darwin
- os/arch: arm64 (ARMv8 compatible)
- go/version: go1.20.2
- go/linking: dynamic
- go/tags: cmount
```

> Also - do you need to use leading /? Try your commands without a leading / and if they work use that.

I do not really need them but unfortunately removing them didn't help either. Error stays the same.

I would also like to repeat here that if I use `v1.60.1` it works so something must have changed after that. The log from `v1.60.1`:

```
2023/03/23 14:29:43 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.60.1" starting with parameters ["rclone" "-vv" "--dump" "bodies" "--log-file" "bug.log" "--config" "rclone.conf" "lsd" "target:/TEST"]
2023/03/23 14:29:43 DEBUG : Creating backend with remote "target:/TEST"
2023/03/23 14:29:43 DEBUG : Using config file from "/Users/example/rclone.conf"
2023/03/23 14:29:43 DEBUG : ftp://example.com:21/TEST: Connecting to FTP server
2023/03/23 14:29:43 DEBUG : ftp://example.com:21/TEST: dial("tcp","example.com:21")
2023/03/23 14:29:43 DEBUG : ftp://example.com:21/TEST: > dial: conn=*fshttp.timeoutConn, err=<nil>
2023/03/23 14:29:44 DEBUG : FTP Rx: "220 Service ready for new user."
2023/03/23 14:29:44 DEBUG : FTP Tx: "USER ******************"
2023/03/23 14:29:44 DEBUG : FTP Rx: "331 User name okay, need password for ******************."
2023/03/23 14:29:44 DEBUG : FTP Tx: PASS *****
2023/03/23 14:29:45 DEBUG : FTP Rx: "230 User logged in, proceed."
2023/03/23 14:29:45 DEBUG : FTP Tx: "FEAT"
2023/03/23 14:29:45 DEBUG : FTP Rx: "211-Extensions supported"
2023/03/23 14:29:45 DEBUG : FTP Rx: " SIZE"

2023/03/23 14:29:45 DEBUG : FTP Rx: " LANG en;zh-tw;ja;is"
2023/03/23 14:29:45 DEBUG : FTP Rx: " MLST Size;Modify;Create;Type;Perm"

2023/03/23 14:29:45 DEBUG : FTP Rx: " AUTH TLS"

2023/03/23 14:29:46 DEBUG : FTP Rx: "200 Command OPTS okay."
2023/03/23 14:29:46 DEBUG : FTP Tx: "EPSV"
2023/03/23 14:29:46 DEBUG : FTP Rx: "229 Entering Passive Mode (|||24071|)"
2023/03/23 14:29:46 DEBUG : ftp://example.com:21/TEST: dial("tcp","CENSORED_IP:24071")
2023/03/23 14:29:46 DEBUG : ftp://example.com:21/TEST: > dial: conn=*fshttp.timeoutConn, err=<nil>
2023/03/23 14:29:46 DEBUG : FTP Tx: "MLSD /"
2023/03/23 14:29:46 DEBUG : FTP Rx: "150 File status okay; about to open data connection."
2023/03/23 14:29:47 DEBUG : FTP Rx: "Size=203;Modify=20221213134020.000;Create=20221213131930.000;Type=dir; TEST"
2023/03/23 14:29:47 DEBUG : FTP Rx: "226 Closing data connection."
2023/03/23 14:29:47 DEBUG : FTP Tx: "EPSV"
2023/03/23 14:29:47 DEBUG : FTP Rx: "229 Entering Passive Mode (|||17371|)"
2023/03/23 14:29:47 DEBUG : ftp://example.com:21/TEST: dial("tcp","CENSORED_IP:17371")
2023/03/23 14:29:47 DEBUG : ftp://example.com:21/TEST: > dial: conn=*fshttp.timeoutConn, err=<nil>
2023/03/23 14:29:47 DEBUG : FTP Tx: "MLSD /TEST"
2023/03/23 14:29:47 DEBUG : FTP Rx: "150 File status okay; about to open data connection."
2023/03/23 14:29:48 DEBUG : FTP Rx: "Size=0;Modify=20230323122943.000;Create=20221213132421.000;Type=dir; ."
2023/03/23 14:29:48 DEBUG : FTP Rx: "Size=0;Modify=19700131000000.000;Create=19700131000000.000;Type=dir; .."
2023/03/23 14:29:47 DEBUG : FTP Rx: "Size=5206506;Modify=20170821234648.000;Create=20170821234648.000;Type=file; test.pdf"
2023/03/23 14:29:48 DEBUG : FTP Rx: "226 Closing data connection."
2023/03/23 14:29:48 DEBUG : 4 go routines active
2023/03/23 14:29:48 DEBUG : ftp://example.com:21/TEST: closing 1 unused connections
2023/03/23 14:29:48 DEBUG : FTP Tx: "QUIT"
```
```
rclone v1.60.1
- os/version: darwin 12.6 (64 bit)
- os/kernel: 21.6.0 (arm64)
- os/type: darwin
- os/arch: arm64
- go/version: go1.19.3
- go/linking: dynamic
- go/tags: cmount
```

The major difference I see on the log above is that passive mode is used.
Can you do a git bisection to find the exact commit it started to go wrong? That will give us a clue!

> Can you do a git bisection to find the exact commit it started to go wrong? That will give us a clue!

The latest exact working version is `v1.61.0-beta.6589.313493d51`. The problem appears in `v1.61.0-beta.6590.1628ca0d4` and more specifically after [this](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/commit/1628ca0d46b9ec313c425735ab85d11ec2695317) commit.

By the way, If I use the `--ftp-disable-mlsd` flag, the above connection works again, but I do not think it should be disabled at all times because I am using the FTP backend with various FTP servers, not just the one I provided the log for.

Great sleuthing - thank you.

So it seems the server is returning a buggy response for "MLST /TEST" (with the blank line) but before 1628ca0d46b9ec313c425735ab85d11ec2695317 we didn't use that - we used a less efficient way of listing the directory by listing the parent "MLSD /"

I think the best way to fix this would be to provide a pull request to the upstream repo to ignore blank lines on the end of the `MLST` response.

@panthony you did both the rclone commit and the upstream `MLST` support - what do you think of this? Can you do an upstream PR to fix?

@ncw I encountered an FTP server in the wild that was not compliant with the RFC 2389 and the maintainer of the upstream project was not particularly inclined to address the problem:

https://github.com/jlaffaye/ftp/issues/260

Which was unfortunate.

But your buggy response has not quite the same issue so maybe yours is more recent and/or more widespread with may change things.
I think this problem is caused by an extra blank line in the MLST output @panthony if you take a look at the first log in the thread
Same issue here with _Serveur FTP_ and _FTP Serveur WiFi_ Android apps as the FTP server
@danbeibei can you send a play store link for that app please and I'll give it a go. - Thanks

Thanks for the links @danbeibei very helpful.

I managed to reproduce this.

I've made a fix for the upstream library which I've temporarily forked.

Can you give this a go please @alolis and @danbeibei 

[v1.63.0-beta.6930.4bbebd7f1.fix-6879-ftp-list](https://beta.rclone.org/branch/fix-6879-ftp-list/v1.63.0-beta.6930.4bbebd7f1.fix-6879-ftp-list/) on branch [fix-6879-ftp-list](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/tree/fix-6879-ftp-list) (uploaded in 15-30 mins)

Thanks for the fix! It solves the `unsupported LIST line` error for me with the Android apps.

The second error @alolis described is still here though, but I don't know if it is related. It seems to fail creating new directories.
In this example the `tmp` directory does not exist on the remote `phone`. On the _fix-6879-ftp-list_ branch a `501 Not a valid pathname` error is returned:
```
$ rclone-v1.63.0-beta.6930.4bbebd7f1.fix-6879-ftp-list-linux-amd64/rclone copy -vv --dump bodies ./tmp phone:tmp

2023/03/28 07:37:17 DEBUG : Creating backend with remote "./tmp"

2023/03/28 07:37:17 DEBUG : FTP Tx: "MLST tmp"
2023/03/28 07:37:17 DEBUG : FTP Rx: "501 Not a valid pathname."
2023/03/28 07:37:17 DEBUG : FTP Tx: "NOOP"
2023/03/28 07:37:17 DEBUG : FTP Rx: "200 Command NOOP okay."
2023/03/28 07:37:17 Failed to create file system for "phone:tmp": 501 Not a valid pathname.
```
On version v1.60.1 the directory is successfully created and content copied:
```
$ rclone-v1.60.1-linux-amd64/rclone copy -vv --dump bodies ./tmp phone:tmp
```
